title: Mining runite ore (free-to-play)

properties.name: description
properties.value: Mining runite ore, a high-level ore that frequently sells for a high price (10,885 coins), is an achievement in itself. The runite rocks are highly competed over and are often depleted of their resources, so miners need to switch worlds in order to find fresh ones. There is only one place in Free-to-play where players can mine it: the Lava Maze runite mine, which contains two rocks. It is located north-west of the Lava Maze in level 46 Wilderness. Since it is in the Wilderness, miners should not take anything they are not prepared to lose. It is essential for miners to mine with extreme caution, since there is the always-looming threat of player killers, who will show up.

content:
The methods in this guide may involve considerable risk, including (but not limited to): loss of money/items, unstable prices, and/or slow GE resale.
Reason: Takes place in the Wilderness; do not bring anything you are not willing to lose if going there.
Mining runite ore
Requirements
Skills
85+ , 40 (optional), 40+ (optional), 25 (optional)
Items
Rune pickaxe, Rune armour (optional), Runes for teleportation spells
Quest
None
Other
Anchovy pizza or Swordfish
Results
ProfitExperience gained
435,400 5,000
InputsOutputs (435,400)
40 Ã— Runite ore (435,400)
A map of the Wilderness.

Mining runite ore, a high-level ore that frequently sells for a high price (10,885 coins), is an achievement in itself. The runite rocks are highly competed over and are often depleted of their resources, so miners need to switch worlds in order to find fresh ones. There is only one place in Free-to-play where players can mine it: the Lava Maze runite mine, which contains two rocks. It is located north-west of the Lava Maze in level 46 Wilderness. Since it is in the Wilderness, miners should not take anything they are not prepared to lose. It is essential for miners to mine with extreme caution, since there is the always-looming threat of player killers, who will show up.

With 40 , you can wield your rune pickaxe for an extra inventory space. With 40 (optional), you can wear rune armour to defend yourself against player killers, but simply not wearing armour or wearing light armour may be better so you can run to level 20 Wilderness, allowing you to teleport away (though some player killers may prevent you from teleporting with the Tele Block spell).

Before venturing out there, miners should bring the best food in free-to-play, swordfish or anchovy pizzas (pizza takes longer to eat, but heals more overall) and a Melee weapon, if the player intends to fight back against potential player killers (optional). Another option is bringing a few runes (1-10 casts) to cast snare on the player killers for a higher chance of getting "gap" and allowing one to get away.

Having another account acting as a scout, preferably a low-level account as they are less likely to be attacked, can be used to assess the risks on a certain world and find available rocks before the miner travels there.

A good strategy is to track the ore respawn times between worlds, so you cycle through a certain rotation of worlds, visiting each world every 12 minutes and mining the two rocks as soon as they spawn.

With skill and luck, miners can get between 30 and 60 ores an hour, thus yielding between 326,550 and 653,100 coins, but the typical norm averages at roughly 40 ores per hour, which is 435,400 coins, due to constant world hopping and bank time.

Due to constantly changing prices on the Grand Exchange, some information in this article may or may not be current.
It is strongly recommended to check the live prices on the Grand Exchange before making large investments in any method.
All prices on this page are cached, meaning it is possible that they appear out of date.
To force a new cache of this page, click this link.
If a money making method is out of date, you can edit it or leave a message on the talk page.

[[Mining]] [[runite ore]], a high-level [[Mining#Mineable items|ore]] that frequently sells for a high price ({{NoCoins|{{GEP|Runite ore}}}} coins), is an achievement in itself. The [[runite rock]]s are highly competed over and are often depleted of their resources, so miners need to [[world switching|switch worlds]] in order to find fresh ones. There is only one place in [[Free-to-play]] where players can mine it: the [[Lava Maze runite mine]], which contains two rocks. It is located north-west of the [[Lava Maze]] in level 46 [[Wilderness]]. '''Since it is in the Wilderness, miners should not take anything they are not prepared to lose.''' It is '''essential''' for miners to mine with extreme caution, since there is the always-looming threat of [[player killing|player killer]]s, who '''will''' show up.

With {{SCP|Attack|40}}, you can wield your [[rune pickaxe]] for an extra inventory space. With {{SCP|Defence|40}} (optional), you can wear [[rune armour]] to defend yourself against player killers, but simply not wearing armour or wearing light armour may be better so you can run to level 20 Wilderness, allowing you to teleport away (though some player killers may prevent you from teleporting with the [[Tele Block]] spell).

Before venturing out there, miners should bring the best food in free-to-play, [[swordfish]] or [[anchovy pizza]]s (pizza takes longer to eat, but heals more overall) and a [[Melee weapon]], if the player intends to fight back against potential player killers (optional). Another option is bringing a few runes (1-10 casts) to cast [[snare]] on the player killers for a higher chance of getting "gap" and allowing one to get away.

Having another account acting as a scout, preferably a low-level account as they are less likely to be attacked, can be used to assess the risks on a certain world and find available rocks '''before''' the miner travels there.

A good strategy is to track the ore respawn times between worlds, so you cycle through a certain rotation of worlds, visiting each world every 12 minutes and mining the two rocks as soon as they spawn. 

With skill and luck, miners can get between 30 and 60 ores an hour, thus yielding between {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Runite ore|30}}}} and {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Runite ore|60}}}} coins, but the typical norm averages at roughly 40 ores per hour, which is {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Runite ore|40}}}} coins, due to constant world hopping and bank time.
